revised_title: Investigation of the Explosion of Pure Electrolytic Gas
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to analyze the differences in the rate of detonation in electrolytic gas when initiated by a spark in the moist and dried states. They found that the absence of water vapor does not influence the explosion of a mixture of hydrogen and oxygen once the flame has been started by a spark. The results showed that the explosion phenomena in both moist and dry gases were identical.
